did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Juanita White Papers, 1970-1997, Collection Number M354, Special Collections and Archives, James Branch Cabell Library, Virginia Commonwealth University, Richmond, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Juanita White of Richmond, Virginia, on 26 October 2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Juanita White was a founding member of the Richmond branch of the National Organization for Women (N.O.W.). As a member of N.O.W. she served as the local officer of reproductive rights. In 1983 she was the branch's delegate to the National N.O.W. Conference. Around this time she also volunteered as the local branch newsletter editor. During the late 1970's and early 1980's, Juanita White also participated in the activities of the E.R.A. Ratification Council. Juanita White resides in Richmond with her husband.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1970-1997, of Juanita White of Richmond, Virginia, principally consisting of personal files, clippings, correspondence, newsletters, personal daybooks, photographs, and a scrapbook. Materials generally concern her work with women's activist organizations but some materials pertain to her personal life and the life and art of Eleanor Appel Lawrence. There is extensive information regarding the Richmond branch of the National Organization for Women (N.O.W.), and the Richmond branch of the Equal Rights Amendment Ratification Council.

list.item: Series III. National Organization for Women Files, 1970-1977
Series IV. Equal Rights Amendment Files, 1972-1977

scopecontent.p: Correspondence includes a letter, 23 November 1970, from Zelda K. Nordlinger of the Women's Liberation Front in Richmond, Virginia, to Wilma Scott Heide, chairperson of the National Organization for Women in Pennsylvania concerning starting a Richmond branch of N.O.W.; letter, 11 April 1977, from Juanita B. White in Richmond to Evelyn Marr Glazier of the Richmond ERA Ratification Council complaining of the recent divisive acts of the organization; a letter, 22 September 1978, from Harry F. Byrd, Jr., to Juanita B. White concerning his views on the extending of the deadline to accept the Constitutional Amendment; letter, 28 December 1978, from Benjamin Lambert, III, stating that he agrees that the Equal Rights Amendment issue should come to the House floor for a vote; and letter, 11 December 1978, from James S. Christian, Jr., to Juanita White concerning his views on the Equal Rights Amendment.

Contains daybooks, 1975-1986, of Juanita White including dates and notes concerning women's activist organization meetings. There is also a scrapbook, 1975-1991, containing newspaper clippings, photos, correspondence, and N.O.W. newsletters related to women's organizations and women's activists in Richmond; and a copy of "You, Too, Can Sell!" by Eleanor Appel (Lawrence). Scrapbook has been disassembled in order to address preservation issues.

did.unittitle: "You, Too, Can Sell," by Eleanor Appel, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Comprises N.O.W. national organization newsletters, 1974-1977; N.O.W. Richmond branch newsletters, 1976-1977, 1982-1983; Richmond branch history, ca. 1974; and National Conference programs and schedule, 1975, 1982. There are also copies of the National N.O.W. Times, the official journal of N.O.W., 1978-1979.

did.unittitle: Richmond branch Equality Day flyer, n.d.
Equal Rights Amendment Ratification Council Files, 1972-1977

scopecontent.p: Consists of Federal and state legal documents, correspondence, and publications concerning the Equal Rights Amendment. Also contains a copy of the Report of the Task Force on the Effect of Ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment on the Law of Virginia, n.d., submitted by the Subcommittee on the Equal Rights Amendment, Joint Committee on Privileges and Elections; a copy of the Equal Rights Amendment Supporter's Handbook, September 1974; and newsletters, minutes, and meeting announcement, 1976-1977, of the Richmond ERA Ratification Council.

Principally consists of publications from other national feminist organizations. There are also copies of the The Blue Lantern: a New Woman's Journal, ca. 1970's, Pandora: a Washington Women's Journal, 1978, and the Richmond-area Woman Activist newsletter, August 1976.

did.unittitle: The Blue Lantern: a New Woman's Journal, ca. 1970's

scopecontent.p: Comprises clippings, 1974-1979, and n.d. concerning feminist organizations and activists, particularly N.O.W. and its members in Richmond.
Contains photographs of sculptures by Eleanor Lawrence and housed at the Unitarian Church in Richmond, Virginia.
Contains a copy of Leave the Breads a Burning!, feminist music by the Arlington Street Women's Chorus copyright 1974.
